definition: all/both/entirely/(used for emphasis) even/already/(not) at all

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
Chengdu subprovincial city and capital of Sichuan province 四川 in southwest China
for the most part/on the whole/also pr. [da4 du1]
for the most part/on the whole/metropolitan
Dadu, capital of China during the Yuan Dynasty (1280-1368), modern day Beijing

Dadu, capital of China during the Yuan Dynasty (1280-1368), modern day Beijing

Beijing Airport (PEK)/also translated as Capital Airport

sentences.english: Many disaster will happen every day in the world.
sentences.chinese: 在这个世界上，天天都邑发生很多灾难性的工作。

sentences.english: "More than any other subject, weight is delicate, " Maddison said.
sentences.chinese: “体重问题比其他问题都要微妙，”麦迪逊说。

sentences.english: The Browns are all college graduates.
sentences.chinese: 布朗一家人都是大学毕业生。

sentences.english: All these writers run to sentiment.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些作家都有伤感的倾向。

sentences.english: They all wore the most expensive clothes and had beautiful, long, curly hair.
sentences.chinese: 她们都穿着最昂贵的衣服，留着长长的美丽的鬈发。

sentences.english: anywhere you want to go,  there's always somebody friendly.
sentences.chinese: 无论你想去哪儿，都会有些友好的人。

sentences.english: All of them insisted on my staying with them a few days longer.
sentences.chinese: 他们所有的人都坚持要我再跟他们多呆几天时间。

sentences.english: The big boys jumped into the river but little Ned hung back.
sentences.chinese: 大些的男孩子都跳进河里了，但小内德畏缩不前。

sentences.english: When I come to Shengzhou, I always stay there.
sentences.chinese: 我每次来嵊舟，都会待在那里。

sentences.english: Bll the boys laughed to hear the good news.
sentences.chinese: 听见这个好动静然后，所有的男孩都笑了。

sentences.english: Standing on the starting line, we're all cowards.
sentences.chinese: 站在起跑线上，我们都是胆小者。

sentences.english: B:Here they are, will you weigh all our luggage together?
sentences.chinese: 这些都是，要不要把我的全部行李一起过磅？

sentences.english: Rather he'll say, "It's for the child's own good.
sentences.chinese: 而是说，“这都是为了孩子好。

sentences.english: None of this will actually be decided at Bali.
sentences.chinese: 所有这一切实际上都决定在巴里岛。

sentences.english: A visit to one of these places is well worth while.
sentences.chinese: 这些地方的任何一处都是很值得一去的。

sentences.english: Most of the global companies are moving manufacturing facilities out-side of Japan.
sentences.chinese: 大多数跨国公司都在把生产设备迁出日本。

definition: also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
this/these/(commonly pr. [zhei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing)
